Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Splendid \Splen"did\, a. [L. splendidus, fr. splendere shine; cf. Lith. splend["e]ti: cf. F. splendide.] 1. Possessing or displaying splendor; shining; very bright; as, a splendid sun. [1913 Webster]
2. Showy; magnificent; sumptuous; pompous; as, a splendid palace; a splendid procession or pageant. [1913 Webster]
3. Illustrious; heroic; brilliant; celebrated; famous; as, a splendid victory or reputation. [1913 Webster]

splendid adj 1: having great beauty and splendor; "a glorious spring morning"; "a glorious sunset"; "splendid costumes"; "a kind of splendiferous native simplicity" [syn: {glorious}, {resplendent}, {splendiferous}] 2: characterized by or attended with brilliance or grandeur; "the brilliant court life at Versailles"; "a glorious work of art"; "magnificent cathedrals"; "the splendid coronation ceremony" [syn: {brilliant}, {glorious}, {magnificent}]
